00034 digit_t inverse0(const integer& n) {
00035     // Using the Dussé and Kalisk simplification
00036     doubledigit_t x = 2, y = 1;
00037     digit_t n0 = n._get_digit(0);
00038     for (size_t i = 2; i <= bits_per_digit; ++i, x <<= 1)
00039         if (x < ((n0 * y) & ((x << 1) - 1)))
00040             y += x;
00041     return digit_t(x - y);
00042 }
00043 
00047 integer montgomeryR(const integer& n) {
00048     return integer::one() << (bits_per_digit * n._get_length());
00049 }
00050 
00052 integer toMontgomeryForm(const integer& n, const integer& m) {
00053     return (n * montgomeryR(m) % m);
00054 }
00055 
00057 integer fromMontgomeryForm(const integer& n, const integer& m) {
00058     integer inv=invmod(montgomeryR(m), m);
00059     return (n * inv % m);
00060 }

00085 
00089 integer montgomeryMultiplyMod(const integer& a, const integer& b, const integer&
00090     n, digit_t nPrime0)
00091 {
00092     // Using the Dussé and Kalisk simplification
00093     // Unstated parameter B is a power of two representing the number of values
00094     //   that a single digit can hold, i.e. digit_overflowbit
00095     // Unstated parameter L is the number of digits in the modulus, i.e.
00096     //   n._get_length()
00097     // Unstated parameter r is B^L
00098     // nPrime0 is nPrime mod B, or digit zero of nPrime
00099 
00100     const integer B(digit_overflowbit);
00101     const size_t L(n._get_length()), L1(L-1);
00102 
00103     integer t=a*b;
00104     size_t i=0;
00105 
00106     do {
00107         digit_t mi=digit_t(doubledigit_t(t._get_digit(i))*nPrime0);
00108         t += (n * mi) << (bits_per_digit * i);
00109     } while (++i <= L1);
00110 
00111     t >>= (bits_per_digit * L); // Fast divide by r
00112 
00113     if (t >= n) return t - n;
00114     else return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(t);
00115 }
00116 
00117 // cMaxK sets the balance between memory/precalculations required and the number
00118 // of calculations required for an exponentiation. Increasing it can only reduce
00119 // the calculations by a small amount, whereas it increases the memory
00120 // requirements and number of precalculations by an exponential amount. 8
00121 // provides a good balance.
00122 const size_t cMaxK=8;
00123 typedef boost::uint_t<cMaxK>::fast kbitdigit_t; // k bits have to fit into it
00124 typedef std::vector<kbitdigit_t> vkbitdigit_t;
00125 typedef std::vector<integer> vxint_t;
00126 #define ddPowerOfTwo(p) (doubledigit_t(1) << p)
00127 
00128 // The splitIntoKBitDigits function assumes that cMaxK <= bits_per_digit+1,
00129 // it won't work properly if it isn't.
00130 BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(cMaxK <= bits_per_digit+1);
00131 
00132 class TUTable {
00133     public:
00134     typedef std::pair<int, int> value_t;
00135 
00136     const value_t& operator[](size_t x) const { return mTable[x]; }
00137 
00138     static const TUTable& get() {
00139         // Construct a singleton instance on demand
00140         if (mPtr.get()==0) mPtr.reset(new TUTable);
00141         return *mPtr;
00142     }
00143 
00144     private:
00145     TUTable(): mTable(new value_t[ddPowerOfTwo(cMaxK)]) {
00146         value_t *p=&mTable[0], *pe=p+ddPowerOfTwo(cMaxK);
00147         *p++=std::make_pair(0, 0);
00148         int i=1;
00149         while (p!=pe) *p++=calculateValues(i++);
00150     }
00151 
00152     std::pair<int, int> calculateValues(int x) {
00153         int r=0;
00154         while (1) {
00155             if (x & 0x01) return std::make_pair(r, x);
00156             ++r;
00157             x >>= 1;
00158         }
00159     }
00160 
00161     static std::auto_ptr<TUTable> mPtr;
00162 
00163     boost::scoped_array<value_t> mTable;
00164 };
00165 
00166 std::auto_ptr<TUTable> TUTable::mPtr;
00167 
00168 int mostEfficientK(const integer& e) {
00169     doubledigit_t k=cMaxK, kTarget=log2(e)-1;
00170     while (k > 1 && ((k - 1) * (k << ((k - 1) << 1))
00171         / (ddPowerOfTwo(k) - k - 1)) >= kTarget)
00172             --k;
00173     return int(k);
00174 }
00175 
00176 vxint_t precalculateOddPowersOfAa(const integer& a, const integer&
00177     r, const integer& n, size_t k)
00178 {
00179     integer aa=a*r%n, aSquared=a*a%n;
00180 
00181     vxint_t rval;
00182     rval.reserve(size_t(ddPowerOfTwo(k)));
00183     rval.push_back(integer::one());     // Anything to the zeroth power is one
00184     rval.push_back(aa);                 // Anything to the first power is itself
00185 
00186     for (doubledigit_t i=3, ie=(ddPowerOfTwo(k)); i<ie; i+=2) {
00187         aa=aa*aSquared%n;
00188         rval.push_back(integer::zero()); // Even powers not needed or calculated
00189         rval.push_back(aa);              // Odd power
00190     }
00191 
00192     return rval;
00193 }
00194 
00195 vkbitdigit_t splitIntoKBitDigits(const integer& e, size_t k) {
00196     size_t eBits=log2(e), eDigits=(eBits+k-1)/k, i=0, bitsInHopper=0;
00197 
00198     vkbitdigit_t rval;
00199     rval.reserve(eDigits);
00200 
00201     doubledigit_t hopper=0, mask=(doubledigit_t(1)<<k)-1;
00202     while (eDigits-- > 0) {
00203         if (bitsInHopper < k && i < e._get_length()) {
00204             // Add more bits to the hopper
00205             hopper = hopper | (doubledigit_t(e._get_digit(i++)) << bitsInHopper);
00206             bitsInHopper += bits_per_digit;
00207         }
00208 
00209         // Grab k bits off the bottom
00210         if (bitsInHopper > 0) {
00211             rval.push_back(kbitdigit_t(hopper & mask));
00212             hopper >>= k;
00213             bitsInHopper-=k;
00214         } else {
00215             rval.push_back(0);
00216         }
00217     }
00218 
00219     return rval;
00220 }
00221 
00225 integer montgomeryPowerMod(const integer& a, const integer& e, const integer& n)
00226 {
00227     // 0 <= a < n, n is odd
00228     // Returns a^e mod n
00229 
00230     const TUTable &tuTable(TUTable::get());
00231 
00232     if (e.sign()==0) return integer::one();
00233     if (n.even()) throw exceptions::invalid_modulus("montgomeryPowerMod "
00234         "requires an odd modulus");
00235 
00236     // Precalculate some values
00237     const size_t k(mostEfficientK(e));
00238     const integer r(montgomeryR(n));
00239     const digit_t nPrime0(inverse0(n));
00240     const vxint_t oddPowersOfAa(precalculateOddPowersOfAa(a, r, n, k));
00241 
00242     // Slice the exponent (e) up into k-bit digits
00243     vkbitdigit_t eDigits(splitIntoKBitDigits(e, k));
00244 
00245     integer pp;
00246 
00247     kbitdigit_t i=eDigits.back();
00248     eDigits.pop_back();
00249     if (i == 0) {
00250         pp=r%n;
00251     } else {
00252         std::pair<int, int> tu=tuTable[i];
00253         pp=oddPowersOfAa[tu.second];
00254         while (tu.first-- > 0) pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, pp, n, nPrime0);
00255     }
00256 
00257     while (!eDigits.empty()) {
00258         i=eDigits.back();
00259         eDigits.pop_back();
00260 
00261         if (i == 0) {
00262             int t=int(k);
00263             while (t-- > 0) pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, pp, n, nPrime0);
00264         } else {
00265             std::pair<int, int> tu=tuTable[i];
00266 
00267             size_t s=k-tu.first;
00268             while (s-- > 0) pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, pp, n, nPrime0);
00269 
00270             pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, oddPowersOfAa[tu.second], n, nPrime0);
00271 
00272             while (tu.first-- > 0) pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, pp, n, nPrime0);
00273         }
00274     }
00275     return montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, integer::one(), n, nPrime0);
00276 }
